string_table.name: npnxnanbnsnfns00010000101
string_table.string: To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.
Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
You must complete the question before submitting.
Enter your name in the field below:
You have reached the time limit set for the quiz. Press 'OK' to continue.

slidelink.displaytext: Where Does Our Money Come From?
Rachel is often cold at work, so she buys a space heater for her office in order to increase her productivity. Can Rachel be reimbursed with funds from Fund Code 101, 102, or 103?
Can 101 funds be used to purchase steel-toed boots for employees working in an environment with heavy machinery? Why or why not?

Nikkis department decides to have a retirement party for her to celebrate her retirement after working at the University for 20 years. The department wants to buy food and alcohol for the party. Would the department be able to use funds from Fund Code 101, 102, or 103 for this purchase? Why or why not?
Marge passed a certification exam and her supervisor used 101, 102, 103 to purchase flowers. Is this allowable?
Returned overhead (211) and residual funds (212): researchonly dollars

Your department is performing marketing research on consumers spending habits in different countries. The researcher is collecting data by making calls to people in other states, along with people in Canada and the UK. Which part of the phone bill can be paid with funds from Fund Code 201?

Krispy Kreme is sponsoring a UF research project to better understand the effects of eating too many Krispy Kreme donuts on college students. During the first research trial, the test subjects were provided with Dunkin Donuts to consume. Were the funds of this sponsored project properly spent?
Fund 211 is Returned Overhead and is restricted by state statutes that determine 211 funds can only be spent on which of the following?
A researcher signs up for Scientific American magazine for their lab. They ask their fiscal team to use their federal grant (in fund 201) to pay the annual fee. Is this acceptable?

A faculty member and several research graduate students have met in the evening to celebrate the completion of their research project. The faculty member pays for dinner: pizza, soft drinks, and beer. Can the faculty member pay for the dinner using 201 funds?

Your department has decided to start recognizing employee of the week with a party each Friday, including food and soft drinks. The employee will also be recognized with a small gift (less than $20). Can the food and gift at the weekly party be funded by Fund Code 171?
Which of the following are examples of Component Units? Select all that apply.
Are Component Units budget- or cash-based funds?
The College of Veterinary Medicine is hosting a business lunch meeting. Are they permitted to pay for food and alcoholic beverages?

The College of Medicine uses fund 171 to pay for a representative from the CDC to teach faculty about the proper precautions that should be taken to avoid the further spread of the coronavirus. Is this an acceptable expense?
What are some similarities between the guidelines for funds from state appropriations and Fee-for-Service funds?
If a Resident Assistant for UF would like to purchase food for a social for his residents to get to know each other, is he able to use funding to do so?
The UF Surplus Warehouse, a Fee-For-Service Unit, purchased customized pens to advertise their operations with 149 funds. Is this an acceptable purchase?
The OConnell Center, a Fee-For-Service Unit, purchases custom shirts for student workers to wear for a special event, out of fund 149. Is this an acceptable purchase?
